p: Inhibition of α-amylase was not significant compared to the reference standard, but analysis revealed that oregano extract contains bioactive compounds that can inhibit α-amylase. The activity found for oregano extract on α-glucosidase is higher than that reported for the leaf extract of Aphloia theiformis, a medicinal plant used for the management of diabetes (IC 50 of 55.20 µg/mL for the ethanol extract and 77.63 µg/mL for the leaf decoction, respectively) [ 39]. However, the pancreatic lipase analysis revealed O. vulgare L. as showing the lowest enzymatic inhibition (922.35 µg/mL) that this plant [ 39]. These results show the potential that OV ADAR could have for the treatment of chronic diseases.
